alert.note: Alert for McIntosh; Muskogee; Okfuskee; Okmulgee; Pittsburg; Rogers; Tulsa; Wagoner (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 10 at 6:02AM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Rogers, McIntosh, Wagoner, northwestern Pittsburg, Okmulgee, northwestern Muskogee, southeastern Tulsa and eastern Okfuskee Counties through 645 AM CDT... At 601 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 4 miles east of Jenks Riverside Airport to 3 miles southwest of Morris to 4 miles south of Dustin. Movement was east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations in or near the path include... Tulsa... Broken Arrow... Muskogee... Mcalester... Okmulgee... Okemah... Eufaula... Bixby... Jenks... Okfuskee... Glenpool... Coweta... Catoosa... Henryetta... Verdigris... Checotah... Haskell... Inola... Morris... Beggs... This includes the following highways, Interstate 40 in Oklahoma between mile markers 216 and 268. Interstate 44 between mile markers 223 and 243. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: McIntosh; Muskogee; Okfuskee; Okmulgee; Pittsburg; Rogers; Tulsa; Wagoner
